fullText: This polished revival doesn't reinvent the show so much as restore it, reminding us why this tale of young love crossed by ethnic hatred became a classic in the first place.
dtliExcerpt: This polished revival doesn't reinvent the show so much as restore it, reminding us why this tale of young love crossed by ethnic hatred became a classic in the first place.
bwwExcerpt: I was hopeful when, in the production's opening moments, the gang members filed onto the front of the vast, empty stage and looked dead-eyed into the audience. You could imagine any of these able-bodied young brawlers being a deadly weapon all by himself. Then those big, projected close-ups begin. (...
